body_html: @oscarridle, when you freeze the graph you remove the Variable nodes from the graph so you can not save and restore variables with saved model at least not without changing graph and saver. I am not an expert but AFAIK saver can not save frozen graphs. If you want to serialize the converted model you need to save it as graph_def. Please take a look at the tensorrt example in model zoo or the https://devblogs.nvidia.com/tensorrt-integration-speeds-tensorflow-inference/ on how to serialize converted graph.

body: @oscarridle, when you freeze the graph you remove the Variable nodes from the graph so you can not save and restore variables with saved model at least not without changing graph and saver. I am not an expert but AFAIK saver can not save frozen graphs. If you want to serialize the converted model you need to save it as graph_def. Please take a look at the tensorrt example in model zoo or the https://devblogs.nvidia.com/tensorrt-integration-speeds-tensorflow-inference/ on how to  serialize converted graph.
